channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2025030036
item.description:
Report E-2025030036

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-27T15:24:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-11
  • City: ELKO
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 77000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Van trailer caught fire due to brake malfunction. Fire department and first responders contained the fire and Clean Harbors internal emergency response teams responded to remediate the scene. Impacted areas were asphalt, gravel and soil. No water or storm drains were impacted. Remediation of environment completed to NDOT satisfaction. Trailer and all hazmat being transported was a total loss. We cannot provide further packaging specifications.

item.title: Report I-2025030043
item.description:
Report I-2025030043

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-26T21:14:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-15
  • City: Hartford
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PILOT TRAVEL CENTERS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 256000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver of vehicle owned by Pilot Travel Centers crossed an uncontrolled rail-grade crossing without performing the necessary steps to ensure the crossing was clear. As a result, a train made contact with the trailer, resulting in a release of 1400 gallons of diesel fuel from the trailer. Additionally, a fuel tank on the train engine was ruptured, resulting in a release of 600 gallons of dyed diesel.

item.title: Report E-2025030298
item.description:
Report E-2025030298

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-26T21:14:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-24
  • City: GREENSBORO
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EAGLE TRANSPORT CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 15000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Overfill company tank at terminal resulting in a spill contained by the dike with ULSD seeping into the gravel lot. Cleanup vendor assessed and confirmed that the containment unit for the UST had been overfilled, and had roughly 3-4 inches of standing diesel in the bottom of the containment unit. Estimated release of 200-300 gallons with the large majority of product confined to the containment unit. Approximately 23 gallons splashed out and reached the ground. CDG managed this spill cleanup and notified NCDEQ.
